solution_line_template: First find the total number of cups of juice: {initial_quarts} quarts * {cups_per_quart} cups/quart = <<{initial_quarts}*{cups_per_quart}={initial_cups}>>{initial_cups} cups
Then find the reduced volume of the juice: {initial_cups} cups * {reduction_fraction} = <<{initial_cups}*{reduction_fraction}={reduced_volume_cups}>>{reduced_volume_cups} cups

Then add the volume of the sugar to find the total volume of the syrup: {reduced_volume_cups} cups + {sugar_volume_cups} cups = <<{reduced_volume_cups}+{sugar_volume_cups}={final_volume_syrup}>>{final_volume_syrup} cups
